info.title: ORCID Link Service
info.description:
The *ORCID Link Service* provides an API to enable the creation of an interface for a KBase
 user to link their KBase account to their ORCID account.

Once connected, *ORCID Link* enables certain integrations, including:

- syncing your KBase profile from your ORCID profile
- creating and managing KBase public Narratives within your ORCID profile

get.description:
The status of the service.

The intention of this endpoint is as a lightweight way to call to ping the
service, e.g. for health check, latency tests, etc.
Returns basic information about the service and its runtime configuration.
Return the link for the user associated with the KBase auth token passed in the "Authorization" header

200.description: Returns the scrubbed link record for this user; contains no secrets

404.description: Link not available for this user

422.description: Either input or output data does not comply with the API schema

delete.description: Removes the link for the user associated with the KBase auth token passed in the "Authorization" header

422.description: Either input or output data does not comply with the API schema

get.description:
Determine if the user associated with the KBase auth token in the "Authorization" header has a
link to an ORCID account.

200.description: Returns a boolean indicating whether the user account is linked to ORCID

schema.title: Response Is Linked Link Is Linked Get

422.description: Either input or output data does not comply with the API schema

post.description:
Creates a new "linking session"; resulting in a linking session created in the database, and the id for it
returned for usage in an interactive linking session.

201.description: The linking session has been successfully created

422.description: Either input or output data does not comply with the API schema

200.description: Returns the current linking session, scrubbed of private info

schema.title: Response Get Linking Sessions Linking Sessions  Session Id  Get

422.description: Either input or output data does not comply with the API schema
Either input or output data does not comply with the API schema

put.description:
The final stage of the interactive linking session; called when the user confirms the creation
of the link, after OAuth flow has finished.

200.description: The linking session has been finished successfully

422.description: Either input or output data does not comply with the API schema

get.description:
Starts a "linking session", an interactive OAuth flow the end result of which is an access_token stored at
KBase for future use by the user.

parameters.description: A url to redirect to after the entire linking is complete; not to be confused with the ORCID OAuth flow's redirect_url

schema.title: Return Link
schema.description: A url to redirect to after the entire linking is complete; not to be confused with the ORCID OAuth flow's redirect_url

parameters.name: return_link

parameters.description: Whether to prompt for confirmation of linking; setting

schema.title: Skip Prompt
schema.description: Whether to prompt for confirmation of linking; setting

parameters.name: skip_prompt

parameters.description: KBase auth token taken from a cookie

get.description: Fetch the work record, identified by `put_code`, for the user associated with the KBase auth token provided in the `Authorization` header

parameters.description: The ORCID `put code` for the work record to fetch

get.description: Fetch all of the "work" records from a user's ORCID account if their KBase account is linked.

404.description: Link not available for this user

get.description:
Get the ORCID profile for the user associated with the current auth token.

Returns a 404 Not Found if the user is not linked
